heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 21 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 50.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.6°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 48.1°C), feels like temperature (up 50.5°C), and outside temperature (up 48.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 695.6m higher than yesterday, 500.4m higher than the past week, 859.0m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 881m to 3280m and averaged 2590m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and sunlight levels will peak at very high intensity. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The sun is below the horizon, it is probably not the optimal time to be hanging out your washing.
